column5: Got out with Terry, Lloyd and Drew again today. Up at 5:30.. off to meet Terry for 7 in Orillia and the same routine as New Years Day to have us fishing by 8:30 on a Zone 15 lake. Terry's starting to get really pissed about the blind fold though!  A tad brisk this morning at -18C.. but thankfully no wind worth speaking of and the sun came out full. Big difference having a black hut vs the blue Clams. I didn't have to turn my heat on.. just left my door open into the sun, well until I turned it on to boil water for my Mr. Noodles, and then once use to the heat couldn't turn it off. Lloyd had his hut at a balmy 31*C for most of the day, and I forgot to grab a shot of his red neck thermal hut design.. I think he was trying to get Drew to strip down.. but I don't really want to know!  At one point Terry was moving spots and well.. Houston.. we have a man down, but hey look.. he's okay! lol Hope the back straightens itself out tomorrow bud.  Terry, Drew and I got skunked. Lloyd got into a couple of lakers. One keeper and one big squirmer that he let go. Neither had fin clips so suspect natural repros.  The other day I decided to do some new rod holders. My hut had the little rings that flip out but make the rod statically (word?) stiff. Amazing what you can make out of an old door mount shoe rack. These allow the rod to tip ever so easily down if a fish takes the bait.. and take about 3 seconds to remove from the frame to put the cover on for transport.  Mr. Noodles and Chief Boy R D for lunch !  We were on 10 to 11"s of ice!

Looks like a great day to me.  Congrats on the fish Lloyd and great idea with the rod holders Wayne.  If things weren't package I be looking to see what I could find to rig up something similar.  I'll be pondering the idea while I'm in the hut tomorrow.    Hope the back will be OK Terry.
Not too shabby!  I think I still would've opted for that over perch Friday...I'd always risk a skunking for some trout
the million dollar man does it again....way to go lloyd
Nice I would kill for -18 and no wind. It's currently -36 with the wind here.  Help!!! I fallen and I can't get up!!!!
Sounds like you guys had fun out there.... Like the rod holders, very cool design Thanks for sharing Leechman
I imagine he would be seeing as how he was the designated driver...

the back is still sore only took 15 minutes to figure out how  to get out of bed   I do really like those rods holders, I will need to do something like that myself   I saw some fish on the fishfinder when I first got there, so I put the camera down really dark water but I did see a bunch of really small rock bass and that were the only fish I saw on the fishfinder all day simcoe whitefish here I come
You had a hoe in bed....  Wait 'till I see your wife..
she was the h...never mind  so I am typing poorly today.....
Gotta love that hat!
nice setup ...
Hey Terry... I meant to ask you... did you get  your Ice Transducer yet???
Nice Work Wayne, I am looking forward to my first outing of the year next week on Rosseau ... hopefully see a few lakers then ... and then its backwoods for Specks ... cant say where .. cant say when
Some People just know how to live, I'm envious I have to slow things down some and start taken notes. Looks like a great time!
Looks like you had a fun day!
I am thinking it will be in my mailbox on Monday

WAS GOOD TO SEE YOU BOTH AGAIN. TERRY WE HAVE TO GET RID OF THE SMELL IN YOUR HUT WHEN YOU FISH ON MY LAKE LOL IT WAS SLOW TODAY TOO, BUT WE DID GET A FEW FISH AND LOST 7 TODAY. WE FOUND A NEW SPOT IN THE AFTERNOON ON THE WAY HOME THAT EVEN TERRY CAN GET A FISH LOL (LOBLAWS) THEY HAVE ALL YOU WANT LOL HOPE YOUR FEELING BETTER TERRY. GET YOUR BACK IN SHAPE WE HAVE 6 DAY FISHING TRIP COMING SOON.
I offered to stop at the IGA in Brechin on the way home... Terry said he was good ....
LMAO!!!
